contentrichtext.text: {{ref improve|date=March 2013}} {{taxobox |image = Lilium lancifolium.jpeg |image_caption = Tiger Lily |regnum = [[Plantae]] |unranked_divisio = [[Angiosperms]] |unranked_classis = [[Monocots]] |ordo = [[Liliales]] |familia = [[Liliaceae]] |genus = ''[[Lilium]]'' |species = '''''lancifolium''''' |binomial = ''Lilium lancifolium'' |binomial_authority = [[Carl Peter Thunberg|Thunb.]] |}} '''''Lilium lancifolium''''' (syn. ''L. tigrinum'') is a species of [[Lilium|lily]] native to northern and eastern [[Asia]], including [[Japan]]. It is one of several species of lily to which the common name [[Tiger lily]] is applied, and is the species most widely known by this name. ==Growth== Like other true lilies, the [[flower]]s are borne on an erect stem 80–200 cm tall, clothed with the more or less linear [[leaf|leaves]] 6–10 cm long and 1–2 cm broad. It is one of a very small number of species that produce aerial [[bulb]]lets, known as [[bulb]]ils, in the leaf axils along the stem. These can be used to propagate the plant. Flowers on the plant last for a short period of time before they wither and are replaced by newer flowers. ==Cultivation and uses== It is cultivated in Asia for its edible [[bulb]]s. It is also grown as an [[ornamental plant]] for its bold flowers, and has become [[naturalisation (biology)|naturalised]] in parts of North America. The [[cultivar]] 'Splendens' has gained the [[Royal Horticultural Society]]'s [[Award of Garden Merit]].<ref>{{cite web|title=RHS Plant Selector - ''Lilium lancifolium'' 'Splendens'|url=http://apps.rhs.org.uk/plantselector/plant?plantid=3386|accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref> ==Sub-species== Named sub-species in cultivation include; * ''flaviflorum (Makino)'', yellow flowers. * ''fortunei (Matthews)'', large form with woolly stems, * ''splendens (Matthews)'', vigorous plant with larger flowers. == See also == * [[List of edible flowers]] ==References== {{reflist}} *European Garden Flora; vol. 1, 1986. == External links == {{Commons|Lilium lancifolium}} *[http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=2&taxon_id=240001433 Flora of China: ''Lilium lancifolium'' (as ''L. tigrinum'')] *[http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=1&taxon_id=200027720 Flora of North America: ''Lilium lancifolium'' (includes comment on species name)] [[Category:Lilium|lancifolium]] [[Category:Flora of Asia]] [[Category:Medicinal plants]] [[Category:Root vegetables]] {{liliales-stub}} {{vegetable-stub}}
